div.a: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2103 Falconara, near Noto, 24 km. SW of (409) Syracuse, 1908 Burial: c. 400 B.C.? (K) Contents: 700+ AR Catana Syracuse (incl. decadr. of Cimon and tetradr. to Tudeer, Per. III) Other Sicilian mints Athens Disposition: part to Virzi incl. following from J. Hirsch May 6, 1912 and Nov. 14, 1912: Jameson 1293, 1920, 1923-4 Orsi's notes Noe, p. 196 reads "Noto 1908, see 409" (= Falconara 1902); since the Jameson Catalogue refers to Noto 1908, and the two Hirsch sales were both in 1912, the date of discovery was probably 1908 rather than 1902
